snippet: Nearly two million Americans could benefit from at least $26 billion in mortgage relief from the nation's biggest banks as part of a broad government settlement to be announced as early as Thursday, according to state and federal authorities.

lead_paragraph: Nearly two million Americans could benefit from at least $26 billion in mortgage relief from the nation's biggest banks as part of a broad government settlement to be announced as early as Thursday, according to state and federal authorities. It is the latest effort by the government to halt the housing market's downward slide, The New York Times reports. Read more »

headline.main: States Negotiate $26 Billion Deal for Homeowners
